Erica Delagnier

IT Project Manager, Museum explorer

Download my One-Page Resume

Why we should work together

I am a french computer scientist with a 9 years experience in building impactful software.

I discovered Omeka while looking for opportunities to contribute to the future of museums and online exhibits, idealy with open-source solutions.

If you are interested in my profile, I would be delighted to join your team. Have a nice day.

Erica

What I did until today

2020-today

In which I accompanied people in pacifying their relationship to money

I created my own open-source budgeting software and became the regional specialist of a well known national charity. See this podcast (french) for more details.

  • UX
  • Architecture
  • Kotlin
  • VueJs

  • Custommer support and training

2019-2020

In which I kickstarted an innovative project for the french Court of Audit

I was part of the 3d season of the “Entrepreneur d’Intérêt Général” program on the Plume project. I joined an open-source community to contribute to their growing software and adapt it to our specific needs. I eventually lead a team of four.

  • UX
  • NodeJs
  • React
  • Legacy code
  • Teamwork
  • Hiring and training
  • Custommer support and training
  • Communication
2016-2018

In which I taught good coding practices to university students

At the university of Grenoble-Alpes, I created, taught and evaluated a course for bachelor students about version control, unit testing, peer reviewing and clean coding.

  • Peer Review
  • Git
  • Unit Testing
  • Software Craftmanship
  • Teaching
  • Practical experience formalisation
  • Pedagogy
  • Group management
2016-2018

In which I created a software to improve access to research articles

Working for Decalog, I created a web application designed to allow universities and libraries to manage their complex subscriptions to research journals. I ended up leading a team of 3.

  • UX
  • PHP
  • React
  • Architecture
  • UI Design
  • Custommer support and training
  • Teamwork
  • Hiring and training
  • Project Management
2015

In which I helped elderly people to keep living in their own home safely

At Telegrafik, I created the first version of their software using motion sensors installed at home to detect incidents and alert the family if needed.

  • UX
  • Java
  • Architecture

How I learned and continue to learn

I hosted the Paris - Software Craftmanship group

In 2019-2020, I joined and became one of the four hosts of a meetup group that met every month to discuss new tools, methods and best practices in order to improve as professionnals.

I read, read and read some more

As an autodidact since my graduation, I read a number of books related either to software development or to the subject or context of the software I was working on : see my bookshelf

I studied online

Using Moocs, I studied UX Design, Philosophy and Linguistics

I graduated with a 'Computer Science and Applied Mathematics' Master's Degree

I studied at ENSEEIHT, a french Grande école and graduated in 2014.
